org.grules
[Groovy] Class Grules

java.lang.Object
  org.grules.Grules

class Grules

The main class for interacting with grules functionality.

Property Summary
static java.lang.String COMBINED_PARAMETERS_SEPARATOR

Name for rule application with combined parameters is built by concatenation of their names using COMBINED_PARAMETERS_SEPARATOR} as a separator.

Property Detail

COMBINED_PARAMETERS_SEPARATOR

static final java.lang.String COMBINED_PARAMETERS_SEPARATOR
Name for rule application with combined parameters is built by concatenation of their names using COMBINED_PARAMETERS_SEPARATOR} as a separator.

 
Method Detail

applyGroupRules

RulesScriptGroupResult applyGroupRules(java.lang.Class rulesScript, java.util.Map parameters, java.util.Map environment = [:])
Runs a rules script against grouped parameters. The parameters are defined as a map which keys are group names and values are maps of (paramater name -> parameter value) pairs. Usage example:

RulesScriptGroupResult result = Grules.applyGroupRules(TestScriptRules, GET: [id: 1], POST: [login: "admin"])
Parameters:
rulesScript - rules script class
parameters - input parameters
environment - custom functions and variables
Returns:
result of rules application

applyRules

RulesScriptResult applyRules(java.lang.Class rulesScript, java.util.Map parameters, java.util.Map environment = [:])
Runs a rules script against non-grouped parameters. The parameters are defined as a map of (paramater name -> parameter value) pairs. Usage example:

RulesScriptResult result = Grules.applyRules(TestScriptRules, id: 1, login: "admin")
Parameters:
rulesScript - rules script class
parameters - input parameters
environment - custom functions and variables
Returns:
result of rules application

fetchRequestCookies

java.util.Map fetchRequestCookies(HttpServletRequest request)
Creates a map with cookies from the given request object.
Parameters:
request - HTTP request object
Returns:
map with cookies

fetchRequestHeaders

java.util.Map fetchRequestHeaders(HttpServletRequest request)
Creates a map with request HTTP headers from the given request object.
Parameters:
request - HTTP request object
Returns:
map with headers

fetchRequestParameters

java.util.Map fetchRequestParameters(HttpServletRequest request, java.util.List listParameters = [])
Creates a map with HTTP parameters from the given request object.
Parameters:
request - HTTP request object
listParameters - collection of parameters that represent list of values not a single string
Returns:
map with parameters, where key is a parameter name and value is a string or a list of strings

newGroupRulesApplicator

groovy.lang.Closure newGroupRulesApplicator(java.lang.Class rulesScript, java.util.Map environment = [:])
Creates a closure that runs a given rules script against passed parameters (grouped). Usage example:

def test = Grules.newGroupRulesApplicator(TestScriptRules)
RulesScriptGroupResult result1 = test(GET: [id: 1, style: "default"], POST: [login: "admin"]) RulesScriptGroupResult result2 = test(GET: [id: 2])
Parameters:
rulesScript - rules script class
environment - custom functions and variables
Returns:
closure that runs the script

newRulesApplicator

groovy.lang.Closure newRulesApplicator(java.lang.Class rulesScript, java.util.Map environment = [:])
Creates a closure that runs a given rules script against passed parameters (ungrouped). Usage example:

def test = Gruless.newRulesApplicator(AllInOneRules)
RulesScriptResult result1 = test(id: 1, style: "default") RulesScriptResult result2 = test(id: 2)
Parameters:
rulesScript - rules script class
environment - custom functions and variables
Returns:
closure that runs the script
